translated: Therefore, listening etc. is not excluded.

original: karmaṇā yajñādinā sahaiva śravaṇādineti kecit /
analyzed: karmaṇā yajña ādinā saha eva śravaṇa ādinā iti kecid
translated: Some say that listening etc. is along with action like sacrifice etc.

original: nanu saniṣṭhasyātmāvalokane karmānuṣṭhānaṃ nāstīty uktam /
analyzed: nanu saniṣṭhasya ātma avalokane karma anuṣṭhānam na asti iti uktam
translated: But it has been said that one who is devoted to the Self has no performance of action in the vision of the Self.

original: mama pariniṣṭhitasyāvalokitasvaparātmanaḥ karmopadeśaḥ kuta iti cet tatrāha loketi /
analyzed: mama pariniṣṭhitasya avalokita sva para ātmanaḥ karma upadeśaḥ kutas iti ced tatra āha loka iti
translated: If it is asked how can there be instruction in action for me who am thus devoted and have seen the Self of myself and others, he says 'in the world' etc.

original: satyaṃ tvam īdṛśa eva tathāpi lokasaṅgrahāya karma kurv iti arjune mayi karma kurvāṇe sarvalokaḥ karma kariṣyati /
analyzed: satyam tvam īdṛśaḥ eva tathā api loka saṅgrahāya karma kuru iti arjune mayi karma kurvāṇe sarva lokaḥ karma kariṣyati
translated: It is true that you are just so. Nevertheless, in order to gather the people, perform action. When I perform action in you, all the people will perform action.

original: itarathā maddṛṣṭāntenājño 'pi lokaḥ karma tyajan patiṣyatīti lokasaṃrakṣaṇaṃ tat phalam ////
analyzed: itarathā mad dṛṣṭāntena ajñaḥ lokaḥ karma tyajan patiṣyati iti loka saṃrakṣaṇam tat phalam
translated: Otherwise, by the example of me, even an ignorant person, abandoning action, will fall. The preservation of the world is its fruit.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: yad yad ācarati śreṣṭhas tat tad evetaro janaḥ /
analyzed: yat yat ācarati śreṣṭhaḥ tat tat eva itaraḥ janaḥ
translated: Whatever a great man does, other people follow.

original: sa yat pramāṇaṃ kurute lokas tad anuvartate ////
analyzed: sa yat pramāṇam kurute lokaḥ tat anuvartate
translated: Whatever standard he sets up, the world follows.

original: śrīdharaḥ / karmakaraṇe lokasaṅgraho yathā syāt tad āha yad iti /
translated: Shridhar: In order that the world may be gathered in the performance of action, he says, Whatever...

original: itaraḥ prākṛto 'pi janas tat tad evācarati /
analyzed: itaraḥ prākṛtaḥ pi janaḥ tat tat eva ācarati
translated: Other people, even ordinary ones, do just that.

original: sa śreṣṭho janaḥ karmaśāstraṃ tannivṛttiśāstraṃ vā yat pramāṇaṃ manyate /
analyzed: sa śreṣṭhaḥ janaḥ karma śāstram tad nivṛtti śāstram vā yat pramāṇam manyate
translated: That great man considers whatever scripture on action or scripture on renunciation to be authoritative.

original: tad eva loko 'py anusarati ////
analyzed: tat eva anusarati
translated: The world follows just that.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana:

original: nanu mayā karmaṇi kriyamāṇe 'pi lokaḥ kim iti tatsaṅgṛhṇīyād ity āśaṅkya śreṣṭhācārānuvidhāyitvād ity āha yad yad iti /
analyzed: nanu mayā karmaṇi kriyamāṇe lokaḥ kim iti tat saṅgṛhṇīyāt iti āśaṅkya śreṣṭha ācāra anuvidhāyi tvāt iti āha yat yat iti
translated: If it is doubted that even when I perform action, why would the world gather in it, it is said that it is because of following the conduct of the great, with the words Whatever...

original: śreṣṭhaḥ pradhānabhūto rājādir yad yat karmācarati śubham aśubhaṃ vā tat tad evācaratītaraḥ prākṛtas tadanugato janaḥ /
analyzed: śreṣṭhaḥ pradhāna bhūtaḥ rāja ādiḥ yat yat karma ācarati śubham aśubham vā tat tat eva ācarati itaraḥ prākṛtaḥ tad anugataḥ janaḥ
translated: Whatever good or bad action a great man, a principal person such as a king, does, other people, ordinary followers, do just that.

original: na tv anyat svātantryeṇety arthaḥ /
analyzed: na tu anyat svātantryeṇa iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is, not anything else independently.

original: nanu śāstram avalokyāśāstrīyaṃ śreṣṭhācāraṃ parityajya śāstrīyam eva kuto nācarati loka ity āśaṅkyācāravat pratipattāv api śreṣṭhānusāritām
analyzed: nanu śāstram avalokya a śāstrīyam śreṣṭha ācāram parityajya śāstrīyam eva kutas nā ācarati lokaḥ iti āśaṅkya ācāra vat pratipattau api śreṣṭha anusāri tām
translated: But, seeing that the scriptures are authoritative, why does the world not abandon non-scriptural conduct and follow only what is scriptural? Anticipating this doubt, he shows that in following also, as in conduct, there is conformity to the best,

original: itarasya darśayati sa yad iti /
analyzed: itarasya darśayati sa yat iti
translated: with the words 'Whatever' (he does).

original: sa śreṣṭho yal laukikaṃ vaidikaṃ vā pramāṇaṃ kurute pramāṇatvena manyate tad eva loko 'py anuvartate pramāṇaṃ kurute na tu svātantryeṇa kiṃcid
analyzed: sa śreṣṭhaḥ yat laukikam vaidikam vā pramāṇam kurute pramāṇa tvena manyate tat eva anuvartate pramāṇam kurute na tu svātantryeṇa kiṃcid
translated: Whatever that best person does as a means of knowledge, whether worldly or Vedic, the world follows that very thing as a means of knowledge, not anything independently.

original: ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: iti arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

original: tathā ca pradhānabhūtena tvayā rājñā lokasaṃrakṣaṇārthaṃ karma kartavyam eva pradhānānuyāyino janavyavahārā bhavantīti nyāyād ity abhiprāyaḥ
analyzed: tathā ca pradhāna bhūtena tvayā rājñā loka saṃrakṣaṇa artham karma kartavyam eva pradhāna anuyāyinaḥ jana vyavahārāḥ bhavanti iti nyāyāt iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: And the idea is that, being the principal person, you, the king, should perform action for the protection of the world, because the conduct of the people follows the principal person, according to the rule.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /🔽lokasaṅgrahaprakāram evāha yad yad iti ////
analyzed: loka saṅgraha prakāram eva āha yat yat iti
translated: Visvanatha.🔽He states the way of gathering the world with the words 'Whatever' (he does).

original: baladevaḥ / lokasaṅgrahaprakāram evāha yad yad iti /
analyzed: eva āha     iti
translated: Balarama. He states the way of gathering the world with the words 'Whatever' (he does).

original: śreṣṭho mahattamo yat karma yathācarati tat karma tathaivetaraḥ kaniṣṭho 'py ācarati /
analyzed: śreṣṭhaḥ mahattamaḥ yat karma yathā ācarati tat karma tathā eva itaraḥ kaniṣṭhaḥ u pi ācarati
translated: Whatever action the best person performs, the other, the inferior one, also performs that very action in the same way.

original: sa śresṭhas tasmin karmaṇi yac chāstraṃ pramāṇaṃ kurute manyate lokaḥ kaniṣṭho 'pi tadanuyāyī tad evānuvartate 'nasarati /
analyzed: sa śresṭhaḥ tasmin karmaṇi yat śāstram pramāṇam kurute manyate lokaḥ kaniṣṭhaḥ u pi tad anuyāyī tat eva anuvartate
translated: He is the best in that action who makes the scripture the authority. Even the inferior person who follows that is considered by the world to be the same, to be following that, to be going in the same direction.

original: śāstropetaṃ śreṣṭhācaraṇaṃ kalyāṇalipsunā kaniṣṭhenānuṣṭheyam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: śāstra upetam śreṣṭha ācaraṇam kalyāṇa lipsunā kaniṣṭhena anuṣṭheyam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the conduct of the best, which is in accordance with scripture, should be followed by the inferior person who desires what is good.

original: itthaṃ ca tejasvinaḥ śreṣṭhasya ca yat kvacit svairācaraṇaṃ tadvyāvṛtam /
analyzed: ittham ca tejasvinaḥ śreṣṭhasya ca yat kvacid svaiḥ ācaraṇam tat vyāvṛtam
translated: And thus the independent conduct of the brilliant best person is excluded in some cases.

original: tasya śreṣṭhakṛtatve 'pi śāstropetatvābhāvāt ////
analyzed: tasya śreṣṭha kṛta tve pi śāstra upeta tva abhāvāt
translated: Even though done by the best, it is excluded because it is not in accordance with scripture.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Bhagavad Gita

original: na me pārthāsti kartavyaṃ triṣu lokeṣu kiṃcana /
analyzed: na me pārtha asti kartavyam triṣu lokeṣu kiṃcana
translated: O Partha, I have nothing to do in the three worlds.

original: nānavāptam avāptavyaṃ varta eva ca karmaṇi ////
analyzed: na anavāptam avāptavyam varte eva ca karmaṇi
translated: There is nothing unattained that needs to be attained. I am engaged only in action.

original: śrīdharaḥ / atra cāhameva dṛṣṭānta ity āha na ma iti tribhiḥ /
translated: Here, He Himself is the example. This is stated by three verses beginning with Na me (I have nothing to do).

original: he pārtha /
analyzed: he pārtha
translated: O Partha!

original: me kartavyaṃ nāsti /
analyzed: me kartavyam na asti
translated: I have nothing to do.

original: yatas triṣv api lokeṣu anavāptam aprāptaṃ sadāvaptavyaṃ prāpyaṃ nāsti /
analyzed: yatas triṣu api lokeṣu an avāptam a prāptam sadā āvaptavyam prāpyam na asti
translated: Because in the three worlds, there is nothing unattained, not yet obtained, that needs to be attained, that needs to be obtained.

original: tathāpi karmaṇy ahaṃ varta eva karma karomy evety arthaḥ ////
analyzed: tathā api karmaṇi aham varte eva karma karomi eva iti arthaḥ
translated: Still, I am engaged only in action. I do only action. This is the meaning.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana

original: atra cāham eva dṛṣṭānta ity āha na ma iti tribhiḥ /
analyzed: atra ca aham eva dṛṣṭāntaḥ iti āha na me iti tribhiḥ
translated: And here I myself am the example. This is what is said by the three verses beginning with 'na me'.

original: he pārtha na me mama triṣv api lokeṣu kim api kartavyaṃ nāsti /
analyzed: he pārtha na me mama triṣu api lokeṣu kim api kartavyam na asti
translated: O son of Prtha, in the three worlds there is nothing that I have to do.

original: yato 'navāptaṃ phalaṃ kiṃcin mamāvāptavyaṃ nāsti /
analyzed: yatas phalam kiṃcid mama avāptavyam na asti
translated: Because there is no fruit that I have to obtain.

original: tathāpi varta eva karmaṇy ahaṃ karma karomy evety arthaḥ /
analyzed: tathā api varte eva karmaṇi aham karma karomi eva iti arthaḥ
translated: Nevertheless, I am engaged in action, I do perform action, is the meaning.

original: pārtheti sambodhayan viśuddhakṣatriyavaṃśodbhavas tvaṃ śūrāpatyāpatyatvena cātyantaṃ matsamo 'ham iva vartitum arhasīti darśayati ////
analyzed: pārtha iti sambodhayan viśuddha kṣatriya vaṃśa udbhavaḥ tvam śūra apatya apatya tvena ca atyantam mad samaḥ ham iva vartitum arhasi iti darśayati
translated: By addressing him as 'son of Prtha', he shows that you are born in a pure Kshatriya lineage and are extremely like me, being the son of a hero, and should act like me.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha:

original: atrāham eva dṛṣṭānta ity āha tribhiḥ ////
analyzed: atra aham eva dṛṣṭānte iti āha tribhiḥ
translated: Here, I myself am the example. This is what is said by the three verses beginning with 'na me'.

original: baladevaḥ / śreṣṭhaḥ karmaphalanirapekṣo 'pi lokasaṅgrahāya śāstroditāni karmāṇy ācared ity arthe svaṃ dṛṣṭāntam āha na me pārtheti tribhiḥ
analyzed: baladevaḥ śreṣṭhaḥ loka saṅgrahāya śāstra uditāni karmāṇi ācaret iti arthe svam dṛṣṭāntam āha na me pārtha iti tribhiḥ
translated: Baladeva: The meaning is that even the best person, who is indifferent to the fruits of action, should perform actions enjoined by the scriptures for the sake of leading the people. As an example of himself, he says with the three verses beginning with 'na me'.

original: sarveśasya satyasaṅkalpasya satyakāmasya me kartavyaṃ nāsti /
analyzed: sarva īśasya satya saṅkalpasya satya kāmasya me kartavyam na asti
translated: For me, the Lord of all, whose resolve is true, whose desire is true, there is nothing to be done.

original: phalārthinā khalu karmānuṣṭheyam /
analyzed: phala arthinā khalu karma anuṣṭheyam
translated: For one who desires fruits, action is indeed to be performed.

original: na ca nikhilaphalāśrayasya svayaṃ paramaphalātmano me karmāpekṣyam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: na ca nikhila phala āśrayasya svayam parama phala ātmanaḥ me karma apekṣyam iti arthaḥ
translated: And the meaning is that I, who am the support of all fruits, who am myself the supreme fruit, do not depend on action.

original: etad darśayati triṣv iti /
analyzed: etat darśayati triṣu iti
translated: This is shown by the words 'in the three' (verse 18).

original: yataḥ sarveṣu lokeṣu karmaṇā yat phalam avāptavyaṃ tadanavāptam alabdhaṃ mama nāsti sarvaṃ tan madīyam evety arthaḥ /
analyzed: yatas sarveṣu lokeṣu karmaṇā yat phalam avāptavyam tat anavāptam alabdham mama nā asti sarvam tat madīyam eva iti arthaḥ
translated: Because whatever fruit is to be obtained by action in all the worlds, that which has not been obtained, not attained, does not exist for me. The meaning is that all that is mine alone.

original: tathāpi śāstroktaṃ karmāhaṃ karomy evety āha varta iti ////🔽BhG /
analyzed: tathā api śāstra uktam karma aham karomi eva iti āha varte iti  bhg
translated: Nevertheless, I perform action as prescribed by the scriptures. This is what is said by the words 'I abide' (verse 18).

original: yadi hy ahaṃ na varteyaṃ jātu karmaṇy atandritaḥ /
analyzed: yadi hi aham na varteyam jātu karmaṇi atandritaḥ
translated: If at any time I were not to engage in action, being diligent,

original: mama vartmānuvartante manuṣyāḥ pārtha sarvaśaḥ ////
analyzed: mama vartma anuvartante manuṣyāḥ pārtha sarvaśas
translated: then men would follow my path in every way, O son of Prtha.

original: śrīdharaḥ / akaraṇe lokasya nāśaṃ darśayati yadi hy aham iti /
analyzed: darśayati   hi   iti
translated: Sridhar: To show the destruction of the world if he does not act, he says 'If at any time' (verse 18).

original: jātu kadācit /
analyzed: jātu kadācid
translated: At any time.

original: atandrito 'nalasaḥ san yadi karmaṇi na varteya karma nānutiṣṭheyam /
analyzed: atandritaḥ na lasaḥ san yadi karmaṇi na varteya karma na anutiṣṭheyam
translated: If, being diligent, not lazy, I were not to engage in action, not to perform action,

original: tarhi mamaiva vartma mārgaṃ manuṣyā anuvartante anuverterann ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: tarhi mama eva vartma mārgam manuṣyāḥ anuvartante anuverteran iti arthaḥ
translated: then men would follow my path, my way, the meaning is that they would follow it.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana:

original: lokasaṅgraho 'pi na te kartavyo viphalatvād ity āśaṅkyāha yadi hy aham iti /
analyzed: loka saṅgrahaḥ pi na te kartavyaḥ viphala tvāt iti āśaṅkya āha yadi hi aham iti
translated: Fearing that even the protection of the world is not to be done by you because it is fruitless, he says 'If at any time' (verse 18).

original: yadi punar aham atandrito 'nalasaḥ san karmaṇi jātu kadācin na varteya nānutiṣṭheyaṃ
analyzed: yadi punar aham atandritaḥ na lasaḥ san karmaṇi jātu kadācid na varteya na anutiṣṭheyam
translated: If, again, I, being diligent and not lazy, were never to engage in work,

original: karmāṇi tadā mama śreṣṭhasya sato vartma mārgaṃ he pārtha manuṣyāḥ karmādhikāriṇaḥ
analyzed: karmāṇi tadā mama śreṣṭhasya sataḥ vartma mārgam he pārtha manuṣyāḥ karma adhikāriṇaḥ
translated: then, O son of Prtha, men, who are entitled to work, would follow the path, the way of life, of Me, the best of all.

original: santo 'nuvartante 'nuvarteran sarvaśaḥ sarvaprakāraiḥ // //
analyzed: santaḥ nuvartante nuvarteran sarvaśas sarva prakāraiḥ
translated: They would follow it in every way.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha:

original: anuvartate 'nuvarterann ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: anuvartate nuvarteran iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that they would follow.

original: baladevaḥ / yadīti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ yadi iti
translated: Balarama:

original: ahaṃ sarveśvaraḥ siddhasarvārtho 'pi yadukulāvatīrṇo jātu kadācit tatkulocite
analyzed: aham sarva īśvaraḥ siddha sarva arthaḥ yadu kula avatīrṇaḥ jātu kadācid tad kula ucite
translated: If, although I am the Lord of all, and have accomplished all My objectives, I, having descended into the Yadu dynasty, were never to engage in the work proper to that dynasty,

original: śāstrokte karmaṇi na varteya tan na kuryām atandritaḥ sāvadhānaḥ san tarhi māṃ dṛṣṭāntaṃ
analyzed: śāstra ukte karmaṇi na varteya tat na kuryām atandritaḥ sa avadhānaḥ san tarhi mām dṛṣṭāntam
translated: as enjoined by the scriptures, then, being diligent, not being inattentive, I would not do that work. Then, taking Me as an example,

original: kṛtvā manuṣyāḥ śreṣṭhasya mama vartma kulavihitācāratyāgarūpam anuvarteran tato
analyzed: kṛtvā manuṣyāḥ śreṣṭhasya mama vartma kula vihita ācāra tyāga rūpam anuvarteran
translated: men would follow the path of Me, the best of all, which consists of renouncing the conduct proper to one's family. Then

original: bhraṃśerann ity arthaḥ // //
analyzed: bhraṃśeran iti arthaḥ
translated: they would fall, is the meaning.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Sri Sridhara:

original: utsīdeyur ime lokā na kuryāṃ karma ced aham /
analyzed: utsīdeyuḥ ime lokāḥ na kuryām karma ced aham
translated: If I did not perform work, these worlds would perish.

original: saṃkarasya ca kartā syām upahanyām imāḥ prajāḥ ////
analyzed: saṃkarasya ca kartā syām upahanyām imāḥ prajāḥ
translated: And I would be the cause of confusion and the destroyer of these people.

original: śrīdharaḥ / tataḥ kiṃ /
translated: What then?

original: ata āha utsīdeyur iti /
analyzed: atas āha utsīdeyuḥ iti
translated: Hence he says: 'would perish'.

original: utsīdeyur dharmalopena naśyeyuḥ /
analyzed: utsīdeyuḥ dharma lopena naśyeyuḥ
translated: They would perish by the loss of Dharma.

original: tataś ca yo varṇasaṅkaro bhavet tasyāpy aham eva kartā syāṃ bhaveyam /
analyzed: tatas ca yaḥ varṇa saṅkaraḥ bhavet tasya api aham eva kartā syām bhaveyam
translated: And then I would be the doer of that mixed caste that would come about.

original: evam aham eva prajā upahanyāṃ malinīkuryām iti ////
analyzed: evam aham eva prajāḥ upahanyām malinīkuryām iti
translated: Thus I myself would destroy, would defile, all the people.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: śreṣṭhasya tava mārgānuvartitvaṃ manuṣyāṇām ucitam eva anuvartitve ko doṣa ity ata āha utsīdeyur iti /
analyzed: śreṣṭhasya tava mārga anuvarti tvam manuṣyāṇām ucitam eva anuvarti tve kaḥ doṣaḥ iti atas āha utsīdeyuḥ iti
translated: It is only proper for men to follow the path of you, the best. What is the fault in following? Hence he says: 'would perish'.

original: aham īśvaraś ced yadi karma na kuryāṃ tadā madanuvartināṃ manvādīnām api karmānupapatter lokasthitihetoḥ karmaṇo lopeneme sarve lokā utsīdeyur
analyzed: aham īśvaraḥ ced yadi karma na kuryām tadā mad anuvartinām manu ādīnām api karma anupapatteḥ loka sthiti hetoḥ karmaṇaḥ lopena ime sarve lokāḥ utsīdeyuḥ  /
translated: If I, the Lord, were not to act, then, due to the impossibility of action even for Manu and others who follow me, by the loss of action which is the cause of the existence of the world, all these worlds would perish.

original: vinaśyeyuḥ /
analyzed: vinaśyeyuḥ
translated: They would be destroyed.

original: tataś ca varṇasaṃkarasya ca kartāham eva syām /
analyzed: tatas ca varṇa saṃkarasya ca kartā aham eva syām
translated: And then I myself would be the doer of the mixed caste.

original: tena cemāḥ sarvāḥ prajā aham evopahanyāṃ dharmalopena vināśayeyam /
analyzed: tena ca imāḥ sarvāḥ prajāḥ aham eva upahanyām dharma lopena vināśayeyam
translated: And by that I would destroy all these people, would annihilate them by the loss of Dharma.

original: kathaṃ ca prajānām anugrahārthaṃ pravṛtta īśvaro 'haṃ tāḥ sarvā vināśayeyam ity abhiprāyaḥ /
analyzed: katham ca prajānām anugraha artham pravṛttaḥ īśvaraḥ ham tāḥ sarvāḥ vināśayeyam iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: And how could I, the Lord who has engaged in the favor of the people, destroy all of them? This is the idea.

original: yad yad ācaratīty āder aparā yojanā /
analyzed: yat yat ācarati iti ādeḥ aparā yojanā
translated: Another interpretation of 'whatever he does' and so on.

original: na kevalaṃ lokasaṃgrahaṃ sampaśyan kartum arhasy api tu śreṣṭhācāratvād apīty āha yad yad iti /
analyzed: na kevalam loka saṃgraham sampaśyan kartum arhasi api tu śreṣṭha ācāra tvāt api iti āha yat yat iti
translated: Not only out of consideration for the preservation of the world, but also because of being the best conduct, therefore it is said: Whatever...

original: tathā ca mama śreṣṭhasya yādṛśa eva ācāras tādṛśa eva madanuvartinā tvayānuṣṭheyo na svātantryeṇānya ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: tathā ca mama śreṣṭhasya yādṛśaḥ eva ācāraḥ tādṛśaḥ eva mad anuvartinā tvayā anuṣṭheyaḥ na svātantryeṇa anyaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: And thus, just as is my conduct as the best, just such should be followed by you who follow me, and not independently by another. This is the meaning.

original: kīdṛśas tavācāro yo mayānuvartanīya ity ākāṅkṣāyāṃ na me pārthety ādibhis tribhiḥ ślokais tatpradarśanam iti ////
analyzed: kīdṛśaḥ tava ācāraḥ yaḥ mayā anuvartanīyaḥ iti ākāṅkṣāyām na me pārtha iti ādibhiḥ tribhiḥ ślokaiḥ tad pradarśanam iti
translated: When there is a desire as to what kind of conduct of yours should be followed by me, that is shown by the three verses beginning with Not mine...

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha:

original: utsīdeyur māṃ dṛṣṭāntīkṛtya dharmam akurvāṇā bhraṃśeyuḥ /
analyzed: utsīdeyuḥ mām dṛṣṭāntīkṛtya dharmam a kurvāṇāḥ bhraṃśeyuḥ
translated: Would perish means would fall away, making me an example, not performing dharma.

original: tataś ca varṇasaṅkaro bhavet tasyāpy aham eva kartā syām evam aham eva prajā hanyām /
analyzed: tatas ca varṇa saṅkaraḥ bhavet tasya api aham eva kartā syām evam aham eva prajāḥ hanyām
translated: And then there would be a mixture of castes, and I myself would be the doer of that, thus I myself would destroy the people.

original: malināḥ kuryām ////
analyzed: malināḥ kuryām
translated: I would make them impure.

original: baladevaḥ / tataḥ kiṃ syād ity āha utsīdeyur iti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ tatas kim syāt iti āha utsīdeyuḥ iti
translated: Baladeva: What would happen then? It is said: Would perish.

original: ahaṃ sarvaśreṣṭhaś cet śāstroktaṃ karma na kuryāṃ tarhīme lokā utsīdeyur vibhraṣṭamaryādāḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: aham sarva śreṣṭhaḥ ced śāstra uktam karma na kuryām tarhi ime lokāḥ utsīdeyuḥ vibhraṣṭa maryādāḥ syuḥ
translated: If I, being the best of all, do not perform the actions enjoined by the scriptures, then these worlds would perish, their boundaries destroyed.

original: tadvibhraṃśe sati yaḥ saṅkaraḥ syāt tasyāpy aham eva kartā syām /
analyzed: tad vibhraṃśe sati yaḥ saṅkaraḥ syāt tasya api aham eva kartā syām
translated: And if there is a breach of that, I myself would be the cause of the confusion that would result.

original: evaṃ ca prajāpatir aham imāḥ prajāḥ sāṅkaryadoṣeṇopahanyāṃ malināḥ kuryām /
analyzed: evam ca prajāpatiḥ aham imāḥ prajāḥ sāṅkarya doṣeṇa upahanyām malināḥ kuryām
translated: And thus I, Prajapati, would contaminate these creatures by the fault of mixing, would make them impure.

original: tathā ca eṣa setur vidharaṇa eṣāṃ lokānām asaṃbhedāya iti śrutyā lokamaryādāvidhārakatvena parigītasya me tanmaryādābhedakatvaṃ syād
analyzed: tathā ca eṣa setuḥ vidharaṇaḥ eṣām lokānām a saṃbhedāya iti śrutyā loka maryādā vidhāraka tvena parigītasya me tat maryādā bhedaka tvam syāt
translated: And thus, my function as the upholder of the boundaries of the worlds, as sung about by the Shruti thus: This is the dam, the upholder of these worlds, for the sake of non-confusion, would be violated.

original: evaṃ upadiśato 'pi harer yat kiṃcit svabhaktasukhecchoḥ svairācaritaṃ dṛṣṭaṃ /
analyzed: evam upadiśataḥ pi hareḥ yat kiṃcid sva bhakta sukha icchoḥ svaiḥ ācaritam dṛṣṭam
translated: Even though Hari teaches thus, some slight independent conduct is seen in Him, who desires the happiness of His devotees.

original: tat khalu vidhāyakena tadvacasānupetatvād īśvarīyatvāc cāvarair naivācaraṇīyam /
analyzed: tat khalu vidhāyakena tad vacasā anupeta tvāt īśvarīya tvāt ca avaraiḥ na eva ācaraṇīyam
translated: But that, being not in accord with His words as the ordainer, and being of the nature of God, should not be practiced by those below.

original: yad uktaṃ śrīmatā śukena
analyzed: yat uktam śrīmatā śukena
translated: As has been said by the illustrious Suka:

original: īśvarāṇāṃ vacaḥ satyaṃ
analyzed: īśvarāṇām vacaḥ satyam
translated: The words of the Lords are true,

original: tathaivācaritaṃ kvacit /🔽teṣāṃ yat svavacoyuktaṃ
analyzed: tathā eva ācaritam kvacid  teṣām yat sva vacaḥ yuktam
translated: and sometimes they act accordingly.🔽One who is intelligent should practice

original: buddhimāṃs tat samācaret //🔽naitat samācarej jātu
analyzed: buddhimān tat samācaret  na etat samācaret jātu
translated: what is in accord with their words.🔽One who is not the Lord should not practice this

original: manasāpi hy anīśvaraḥ /🔽vinaśyaty ācaran mauḍhyād🔽yathārudro /
analyzed: manasā api hi anīśvaraḥ  vinaśyati ācaran mauḍhyāt  yathā rudraḥ
translated: even mentally.🔽By practicing out of foolishness, one perishes,

original: bdhijaṃ viṣam // BhP / / iti ////
analyzed: bdhi jam viṣam bhp  iti
translated: like Rudra by the poison from the ocean.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Thus.

original: saktāḥ karmaṇy avidvāṃso yathā kurvanti bhārata /
analyzed: saktāḥ karmaṇi a vidvāṃsaḥ yathā kurvanti bhārata
translated: As the ignorant, attached to action, act, O descendant of Bharata,

original: kuryād vidvāṃs tathāsaktaś cikīrṣur lokasaṃgraham ////
analyzed: kuryāt vidvān tathā asaktaḥ cikīrṣuḥ loka saṃgraham
translated: so should the wise man, not attached, act, desiring to win over the people.

original: śrīdharaḥ / tasmād ātmavidāpi lokasaṅgrahārtha tatkṛpayā karma kāryam evety upasaṃharati saktā iti /
translated: Sri Sridhara: Therefore, even one who knows the Self should perform action out of compassion for the world. The Lord concludes this by saying, As the ignorant, attached to action, act, O descendant of Bharata.

original: karmaṇi saktā abhiniviṣṭāḥ santo yathājñāḥ karmāṇi kurvanti /
analyzed: karmaṇi saktāḥ abhiniviṣṭāḥ santaḥ yathājñāḥ karmāṇi kurvanti
translated: Attached, i.e., deeply engaged in action, the ignorant act as they know.

original: asaktaḥ san vidvān api kuryāt lokasaṃgraham kartum icchuḥ ////
analyzed: asaktaḥ san vidvān api kuryāt lokasaṃgraham kartum icchuḥ
translated: So should the wise man, not attached, act, desiring to win over the people.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana:

original: nanu taveśvarasya lokasaṃgrahārthaṃ karmāṇi kurvāṇasyāpi kartṛtvābhimānābhāvān na kāpi kṣatiḥ /🔽mama tu jīvasya lokasaṃgrahārthaṃ karmāṇi kurvāṇasya kartṛtvābhimānena jñānābhibhavaḥ syād ity ata āha saktā iti /
analyzed: nanu tava īśvarasya loka saṃgraha artham karmāṇi kurvāṇasya api kartṛ tva abhimāna abhāvāt na kā api kṣatiḥ  mama tu jīvasya loka saṃgraha artham karmāṇi kurvāṇasya kartṛ tva abhimānena jñāna abhibhavaḥ syāt iti atas āha saktāḥ iti
translated: Even though You, the Lord, perform actions for the purpose of guiding the people, there is no harm to You, because You have no sense of agency.🔽But for me, the individual soul, performing actions for the purpose of guiding the people, there would be an obstruction to knowledge due to the sense of agency. Therefore, the Lord says, As the ignorant, attached to action, act, O descendant of Bharata.

original: saktāḥ kartṛtvābhimānena phalābhisandhinā ca karmaṇy abhiniviṣṭā avidvāṃso 'jñā yathā kurvanti karma lokasaṃgrahaṃ kartum icchur vidvān ātmavid
analyzed: saktāḥ kartṛ tva abhimānena phala abhisandhinā ca karmaṇi abhiniviṣṭāḥ a vidvāṃsaḥ jñāḥ yathā kurvanti karma loka saṃgraham kartum icchuḥ vidvān ātma vid  /
translated: Attached, i.e., deeply engaged in action due to the sense of agency and the desire for results, the ignorant act. Desiring to win over the people, the wise man, who knows the Self,

original: api tathaiva kuryāt /
analyzed: api tathā eva kuryāt
translated: He should act in the same way.

original: kintu asaktaḥ san kartṛtvābhimānaṃ phalābhisandhiṃ cākurvann ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: kintu asaktaḥ san kartṛ tva abhimānam phala abhisandhim ca akurvan iti arthaḥ
translated: But the meaning is that, being unattached, he should not assume the role of an agent and have a desire for results.

original: bhārateti bharatavaṃśodbhavatvenabhā jñānaṃ tasyāṃ ratatvena vā tvaṃ yathoktaśāstrārthabodhayogyo 'sīti darśayati ////
analyzed: bhārata iti jñānam tasyām rata tvena vā tvam yathā ukta śāstra artha bodha yogyā sīti darśayati
translated: By saying in the Bharata he shows that you are fit to understand the meaning of the scriptures as stated, because you are born in the Bharata dynasty or because you delight in it.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: tasmāt pratiṣṭhitena jñānināpi karma kartavyam ity upasaṃharati saktā iti ////
analyzed: tasmāt pratiṣṭhitena jñāninā api karma kartavyam iti upasaṃharati saktāḥ iti
translated: Therefore, even a firmly established knower of the Self should perform actions. Thus he concludes with sakta etc.🔽Balarama.

original: baladevaḥ / tasmāt pratiṣṭhite 'pi tvaṃ lokahitāya vedoktaṃ svakarma prakurv ity āśayenāha saktā iti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ tasmāt pratiṣṭhite pi tvam loka hitāya veda uktam sva karma prakuru iti āśayena āha saktāḥ iti
translated: With the intention that therefore, even though you are firmly established, you should perform your own duties enjoined by the Vedas for the welfare of the world, he says sakta etc.

original: ajñā yathā karmaṇi saktāḥ phalalipsayābhiniviṣṭās tata kurvanty evaṃ vidvān api kuryāt /
analyzed: ajñāḥ yathā karmaṇi saktāḥ phala lipsayā abhiniviṣṭāḥ tata kurvanti evam vidvān api kuryāt
translated: Just as the ignorant are attached to actions with a desire for results and are absorbed in them, so should the knower of the Self also act.

original: kintv asaktaḥ phalalipsāśūnyaḥ san /
analyzed: kintu asaktaḥ phala lipsā śūnyaḥ san
translated: But he should be unattached, devoid of a desire for results.

original: sphuṭam anyat ////
analyzed: sphuṭam anyat
translated: The rest is clear.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Bhagavad Gita

original: na buddhibhedaṃ janayed ajñānāṃ karmasaṅginām /
analyzed: na buddhi bhedam janayet ajñānām karma saṅginām
translated: One should not create a difference of opinion among the ignorant who are attached to actions.

original: joṣayet sarvakarmāṇi vidvān yuktaḥ samācaran ////
analyzed: joṣayet sarva karmāṇi vidvān yuktaḥ samācaran
translated: The wise one, being engaged, should perform all actions as if they are not being done.

original: śrīdharaḥ / nanu kṛpayā tattvajñānam evopadeṣṭuṃ yuktam /
translated: Sridhara: But it is proper to teach them the knowledge of reality itself out of compassion.

original: nety āha na buddhibhedam iti ajñānām ataeva karmasaṅgināṃ karmāsaktānām akartātmeopadeśena buddher bhedam anyathātvaṃ na janayet /
analyzed: na iti āha na buddhi bhedam iti ajñānām ataeva karma saṅginām karma āsaktānām buddheḥ bhedam anyathātvam na janayet
translated: No, he says, not the alteration of the understanding. He would not produce an alteration of the understanding of the ignorant, who are attached to action, by teaching them that the Self is not the agent.

original: karmaṇaḥ sakāśād buddhivicālanaṃ na kuryāt /
analyzed: karmaṇaḥ sakāśāt buddhi vicālanam na kuryāt
translated: He would not cause the understanding to waver from action.

original: api tu joṣayet sevayet /
analyzed: api tu joṣayet sevayet
translated: But he would encourage them, would serve them.

original: ajñān karmāṇi kārayed ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: ajñān karmāṇi kārayet iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that he would make the ignorant perform actions.

original: katham / yukto 'vahito bhūtvā svayam ācaran san /
analyzed: katham yuktaḥ vahitaḥ bhūtvā svayam ācaran san
translated: How? Becoming engaged, attentive, acting himself.

original: buddhivicālane kṛte sati karmasu śraddhānivṛtter jñānasya cānutpattes tesām ubhayabhraṃśaḥ syād iti bhāvaḥ ////
analyzed: buddhi vicālane kṛte sati karmasu śraddhā nivṛtteḥ jñānasya ca anutpatteḥ tesām ubhaya bhraṃśaḥ syāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that if the understanding is made to waver, faith in actions ceases and knowledge does not arise, so they would fall from both.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana:

original: nanu karmānuṣṭhānenaiva lokasaṃgrahaḥ kartavyo na tu tattvajñānopadeśeneti ko hetur ata āha na buddhīti /
analyzed: nanu karma anuṣṭhānena eva loka saṃgrahaḥ kartavyaḥ na tu tattva jñāna upadeśena iti kaḥ hetuḥ atas āha na buddhi iti
translated: But what is the reason that the protection of the world should be done by the performance of actions alone, and not by teaching the knowledge of reality? To this he says not the alteration of the understanding.

original: ajñānām avivekināṃ kartṛtvābhimānena phalābhisandhinā ca karmasaṅgināṃ karmaṇy abhiniviṣṭānāṃ
analyzed: ajñānām avivekinām kartṛ tva abhimānena phala abhisandhinā ca karma saṅginām karmaṇi abhiniviṣṭānām
translated: Of the ignorant, the non-discriminating, who are attached to action, who are absorbed in action, by the conceit of agency and by the desire for results,

original: yā buddhir aham etat karma kariṣya etatphalaṃ ca bhokṣya iti tasyā bhedaṃ vicālanam
analyzed: yā buddhiḥ aham etat karma kariṣye etad phalam ca bhokṣye iti tasyāḥ bhedam vicālanam
translated: The intellect which thinks, 'I shall do this action and enjoy its fruit,' that should not be disturbed by him.

original: akartrātmopadeśena na kuryāt /
analyzed: akartṛ ātma upadeśena na kuryāt
translated: By teaching the Self as non-agent, he should not cause it.

original: kintu yukto 'vahitaḥ san vidvān lokasaṃgrahaṃ cikīrṣur avidvadadhikārikāṇi sarvakarmaṇi samācaraṃs teṣāṃ śraddhām utpādya joṣayet prītyā
analyzed: kintu yuktaḥ vahitaḥ san vidvān loka saṃgraham cikīrṣuḥ avidvat adhikārikāṇi sarva karmaṇi samācaran teṣām śraddhām utpādya joṣayet prītyā  /
translated: But being engaged, attentive, wise, desiring to gather people, performing all actions under the authority of the ignorant, producing faith in them, he should make them rejoice with love.

original: sevayet /
analyzed: sevayet
translated: He should serve them.

original: anadhikāriṇām upadeśena buddhivicālane kṛte karmasu śraddhānivṛttir jñānasya cānutpatter ubhayabhraṣṭatvaṃ syāt /
analyzed: anadhikāriṇām upadeśena buddhi vicālane kṛte karmasu śraddhā nivṛttiḥ jñānasya ca anutpatteḥ ubhaya bhraṣṭa tvam syāt
translated: If the intellect is disturbed by teaching those who are not qualified, faith in actions ceases and knowledge does not arise, so one would fall from both.

original: tathā coktaṃ
analyzed: tathā ca uktam
translated: And it is said:

original: ajñasyārdhaprabuddhasya sarvaṃ brahmeti yo vadet /
analyzed: ajñasya ardha prabuddhasya sarvam brahma iti yaḥ vadet
translated: If one were to say to the ignorant or half-awakened, 'All is Brahman,'

original: mahānirayajāleṣu sa tena viniyojitaḥ // iti ////
analyzed: mahāniraya jāleṣu sa tena viniyojitaḥ iti
translated: he would thereby be consigned to the great hells.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: alaṃ karmajaḍimnā /
analyzed: alam karma jaḍimnā
translated: Enough with the dullness of action.

original: tvaṃ karmasannyāsaṃ kṛtvā jñānābhyāsenāham iva kṛtārthībhavaiti buddhibhedaṃ na janayet karmasaṅginaṃ aśuddhāntaḥkaraṇatvena karmasv evāsaktimatām
analyzed: tvam karma sannyāsam kṛtvā jñāna abhyāsena aham iva kṛtārthībhava eti buddhi bhedam na janayet karma saṅginam aśuddha antaḥkaraṇa tvena karmasu eva āsaktimatām
translated: You should not generate the disturbance of intellect that says, 'Renouncing action, become fulfilled like me through the practice of knowledge,' to one who is attached to action, who has an impure heart, who is attached to actions alone.

original: kintu tvaṃ kṛtārthībhaviṣyan niṣkāmakarmaiva kru iti karmāṇy eva yojayet kārayet /
analyzed: kintu tvam kṛtārthībhaviṣyan niṣkāma karmā eva iti karmāṇi eva yojayet kārayet
translated: But you, having become successful, should engage in and cause others to engage in only karma without desire.

original: atra karmāṇi samācaran svayam eva dṛṣṭāntībhavet /
analyzed: atra karmāṇi samācaran svayam eva dṛṣṭāntībhavet
translated: Here, performing karma oneself becomes an example.

original: nanu /
analyzed: nanu
translated: But,

original: svayaṃ niḥśreyasaṃ vidvān na vakty ajñāya karma hi /
analyzed: svayam niḥśreyasam vidvān na vakti a jñāya karma hi
translated: knowing the highest good for oneself, one does not speak of karma without knowing it.

original: na rāti rogiṇo 'pathyaṃ vāñchato 'pi bhiṣaktamaḥ // BhP / /
analyzed: na rāti rogiṇaḥ pathyam vāñchataḥ pi bhiṣaktamaḥ
translated: The best physician does not give unwholesome medicine even to a patient who desires it.

original: ity ajitavākyenaitad virudhyate /
analyzed: iti ajita vākyena etat virudhyate
translated: This is contradicted by the statement of Ajita.

original: satyam /
analyzed: satyam
translated: True,

original: tat khalu bhaktyupadeṣṭṛkaviṣayam idaṃ tu jñānopadeṣṭṛkaviṣayam ity avirodhaḥ /
analyzed: tat khalu bhakti upadeṣṭṛka viṣayam idam tu jñāna upadeṣṭṛka viṣayam iti avirodhaḥ
translated: that refers to an instructor of devotion, while this refers to an instructor of knowledge. There is no contradiction.

original: jñānasyāntaḥkaraṇaśuddhyadhīnatvāt /🔽tac chuddhes tu niṣkāmakarmādhīnatvāt /
analyzed: jñānasya antaḥkaraṇa śuddhi adhīna tvāt  tat śuddheḥ tu niṣkāma karma adhīna tvāt
translated: Because knowledge depends on the purification of the internal organ.🔽But that purification depends on karma without desire.

original: bhaktes tu svataḥ prābalyād antaḥkaraṇaśuddhiparyantānapekṣatvāt /
analyzed: bhakteḥ tu svatas prābalyāt antaḥkaraṇa śuddhi paryanta anapekṣa tvāt
translated: But devotion is inherently strong and does not depend on anything up to the purification of the internal organ.

original: yadi bhaktau śraddhām utpādayituṃ śaknuyāt /
analyzed: yadi bhaktau śraddhām utpādayitum śaknuyāt
translated: If one can generate faith in devotion,

original: tadā karmiṇāṃ buddhibhedam api janayet /
analyzed: tadā karmiṇām buddhi bhedam api janayet
translated: then one can also generate a different understanding in the performers of karma.

original: bhaktau śraddhāvatāṃ karmānadhikārāt
analyzed: bhaktau śraddhāvatām karma anadhikārāt
translated: Because those who have faith in devotion are not entitled to perform karma.

original: tāvat karmāṇi kurvīta na nirvidyeta yāvatā /
analyzed: tāvat karmāṇi kurvīta na nirvidyeta yāvatā
translated: One should perform actions as long as one does not become disgusted,

original: matkathāśravaṇādau vā śraddhā yāvan na jāyate // BhP / / iti /
analyzed: mad kathā śravaṇa ādau vā śraddhā yāvat na jāyate
translated: Or until faith arises in listening to my stories and so on.

original: dharmān santyajya yaḥ sarvān māṃ bhajet sa tu sattamaḥ BhP / /iti /
analyzed: dharmān santyajya yaḥ sarvān mām bhajet sa tu sattamaḥ bhp
translated: He who, abandoning all duties, worships Me, he is the best.

original: sarvadharmān parityajya mām ekaṃ śaraṇaṃ vraja Gītā / iti /
analyzed: sarva dharmān parityajya mām ekam śaraṇam vraja gītāḥ iti
translated: Abandoning all duties, take refuge in Me alone. Gita.

original: tyaktvā svadharmaṃ caraṇāmbujaṃ harer🔽bhajann apakvo /
analyzed: tyaktvā svadharmam caraṇa ambujam hareḥ  bhajan apakvaḥ
translated: Abandoning one's own duty and worshipping the lotus feet of Hari,

original: tha patet tato yadi BhP / /
analyzed: patet tatas yadi bhp
translated: if an unripe person falls from there,

original: ityādivacanebhya iti vivecanīyam ////
analyzed: ityādi vacanebhyaḥ iti vivecanīyam
translated: one should understand this from such statements.

original: baladevaḥ / kiṃ ca lokahitecchur jñānī sāvahitaḥ syād ity āha na buddhīti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ kim ca loka hita icchuḥ jñānī sa avahitaḥ syāt iti āha na buddhi iti
translated: Balarama. Moreover, a knower who desires the welfare of the world should be engaged, thus he says not by the intellect etc.

original: vidvān pariniṣṭhito 'pi karmasaṅgināṃ karmaśraddhājāḍyabhājām ajñānāṃ buddhibhedaṃ na janayet /
analyzed: vidvān pariniṣṭhitaḥ u pi karma saṅginām karma śraddhā jāḍya bhājām ajñānām buddhi bhedam na janayet
translated: Even a learned and perfected person should not create a difference of opinion among those attached to action, the ignorant who are dull due to faith in action.

original: kiṃ karmab hir aham iva jñānenaiva kṛtārtho bhaveti karmaniṣṭhātas tadbuddhiṃ nāpanayed ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: kim karmabhiḥ aham iva jñānena eva kṛtārthaḥ bhava iti karma niṣṭhātaḥ tad buddhim na apanayet iti arthaḥ
translated: What is the use of action? I will become fulfilled by knowledge alone. The meaning is that he should not remove their understanding of action.

original: kintu svayaṃ karmasu yuktaḥ sāvadhānas tāni samyak sarvāṅgopasaṃhāreṇācaran sarvāṇi vihitāni karmāṇi yoṣayet prītyā sevayet ajñān karmāṇi kārayed
analyzed: kintu svayam karmasu yuktaḥ sa avadhānaḥ tāni samyak sarva aṅga upasaṃhāreṇa ācaran sarvāṇi vihitāni karmāṇi yoṣayet prītyā sevayet ajñān karmāṇi kārayet  /
translated: But one who is himself engaged in actions, attentive, performing them all perfectly, with all the limbs (of the body) fully engaged, should perform all the enjoined actions, should serve them with love, and should make the ignorant perform actions.

original: ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: iti arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

original: buddhibhede sati karmasu śraddhānivṛtte jñānasya cānudayād ubhayavibhraṣṭās te syur iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: buddhi bhede sati karmasu śraddhā nivṛtte jñānasya ca anudayāt ubhaya vibhraṣṭāḥ te syuḥ iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that when there is a difference of opinion, faith in actions ceases, and since knowledge does not arise, they would be fallen from both.

original: svayaṃ niḥśreyasaṃ vidvān na vakty ajñāya karma hi /
analyzed: svayam niḥśreyasam vidvān na vakti a jñāya karma hi
translated: The knower of the highest good does not speak of action without knowing it.

original: na rāti rogiṇo 'pathyaṃ vāñchato 'pi bhiṣaktamaḥ // BhP / /
analyzed: na rāti rogiṇaḥ pathyam vāñchataḥ pi bhiṣaktamaḥ
translated: The best physician does not give unwholesome medicine even to a patient who desires it.

original: ity ajitoktis tu karmasaṅgītaraparatayā neyā ////
analyzed: iti ajita uktiḥ tu karma saṅgīta rapara tayā neyā
translated: The statement of Ajita should be understood as referring to one who is engaged in action.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: prakṛteḥ kriyamāṇāni guṇaiḥ karmāṇi sarvaśaḥ /
analyzed: prakṛteḥ kriyamāṇāni guṇaiḥ karmāṇi sarvaśas
translated: All actions in every way are performed by the modes of material nature.

original: ahaṃkāravimūḍhātmā kartāham iti manyate ////
analyzed: ahaṃkāra vimūḍha ātmā kartāham iti manyate
translated: The embodied soul bewildered by the modes of nature thinks himself the doer.

original: śrīdharaḥ / nanu viduṣo 'pi cet karma kartavyaṃ tarhi vidvadaviduṣoḥ ko viśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: ced
translated: Śrīdhara: Objection: If even the knower of Brahman must perform actions, then what is the difference between the knower and the non-knower?

original: ity āśaṅkyobhayor viśeṣaṃ darśayati prakṛter iti dvābhyām /
analyzed: iti āśaṅkya ubhayoḥ viśeṣam darśayati prakṛteḥ iti dvābhyām
translated: To show the difference between the two, the Lord says by the two verses beginning with All actions in every way are performed by the modes of material nature.

original: prakṛter guṇaiḥ prakṛtikāryair indriyaiḥ sarvaprakāreṇa kriyamāṇāni karmāṇi /
analyzed: prakṛteḥ guṇaiḥ prakṛti kāryaiḥ indriyaiḥ sarva prakāreṇa kriyamāṇāni karmāṇi
translated: The actions that are performed in every way by the qualities of Nature, i.e., by the effects of Nature, the senses.

original: tāny aham eva kartā karomīti manyate /
analyzed: tāni aham eva kartā karomi iti manyate
translated: I am the doer of those, I am the performer, thus he thinks.

original: atra hetuḥ ahaṃkāreṇa indriyādiṣv ātmādhyāsena vimūḍhabuddhiḥ san ////
analyzed: atra hetuḥ ahaṃkāreṇa indriya ādiṣu ātma adhyāsena vimūḍha buddhiḥ san
translated: The reason for this is: being deluded in intellect by the superimposition of the self on the senses etc. through egoism,

original: madhusūdanaḥ /🔽vidvadaviduṣoḥ karmānuṣṣṭhānasāmye 'pi kartṛtvābhimānatadabhāvābhyāṃ viśeṣaṃ darśayan saktāḥ karmaṇītiślokārthaṃ vivṛṇoti dvābhyāṃ prakṛter
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ  vidvat aviduṣoḥ karma anuṣṭhāna sāmye pi kartṛ tva abhimāna tad abhāvābhyām viśeṣam darśayan saktāḥ karmaṇi iti śloka artham vivṛṇoti dvābhyām prakṛteḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: iti /🔽prakṛtir māyā sattvarajastamoguṇamayī mithyājñānātmikā pārameśvarī śaktiḥ māyāṃ tu prakṛtiṃ vidyān māyinaṃ tu maheśvaraṃ iti śruteḥ /
analyzed: iti  prakṛtiḥ māyā sattva rajaḥ tamaḥ guṇa mayī mithyājñāna ātmikā pārameśvarī śaktiḥ māyām tu prakṛtim vidyāt māyinam tu maheśvaram iti śruteḥ
translated: Although the performance of actions is the same for the learned and the unlearned, he shows the difference through the absence of the notion of being the doer and its presence, and explains the meaning of the verse Those attached to the fruits of action with two verses.

original: tasyāḥ prakṛter guṇair vikāraiḥ kāryakāraṇarūpaiḥ kriyamāṇāni laukikāni vaidikāni
analyzed: tasyāḥ prakṛteḥ guṇaiḥ vikāraiḥ kārya kāraṇa rūpaiḥ kriyamāṇāni laukikāni vaidikāni
translated: By the qualities of Nature, i.e., by its modifications, which are in the form of causes and effects, all kinds of actions, worldly and Vedic,

original: ca karmāṇi sarvaśaḥ sarvaprakārair ahaṅkāreṇa kāryakāraṇasaṃghātātmapratyayena
analyzed: ca karmāṇi sarvaśas sarva prakāraiḥ ahaṅkāreṇa kārya kāraṇa saṃghāta ātma pratyayena
translated: are performed. By egoism, the notion of the aggregate of causes and effects as the self,🔽he thinks.

original: vimūḍhaḥ svarūpavivekāsamartha ātmāntaḥkaraṇaṃ yasya so 'haṅkāravimūḍhātmānātmany
analyzed: vimūḍhaḥ sva rūpa viveka asamarthaḥ ātmā antaḥkaraṇam yasya saḥ haṅkāra vimūḍha ātma anātmani
translated: He whose mind is deluded, who is incapable of discriminating his own nature, whose mind is deluded by egoism, who considers the non-self as the self,

original: ātmābhimānī tāni karmāṇi kartāham iti karomy aham iti manyate kartṛtvādhyāsena /
analyzed: ātma abhimānī tāni karmāṇi kartāham iti karomi aham iti manyate kartṛ tva adhyāsena
translated: thinks that he is the doer of those actions, thinking I am the doer and I am doing. By superimposing the quality of being the agent.

original: kartāham iti tṛnpratyayaḥ /🔽tena na lokāvyayaniṣṭhākhalarthatṛṇām
analyzed: kartāham iti tṛn pratyayaḥ  tena na loka avyaya niṣṭhā khal artha tṛṇām
translated: The verbal ending tasya (of him) is in the third person singular.

original: Pāṇ / / iti ṣaṣṭhīpratiṣedhaḥ ////
analyzed: iti ṣaṣṭhī pratiṣedhaḥ
translated: Therefore, the prohibition of the genitive case by the rule loke avyayaniṣṭhākhapararthatṛṇām (Panini 2.3.3) does not apply here.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: nanu yadi vidvān api karma kuryāt /
analyzed: nanu yadi vidvān api karma kuryāt
translated: Now, if even a knower of the Self performs actions,

original: tarhi vidvadaviduṣoḥ ko viśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: tarhi vidvat aviduṣoḥ kaḥ viśeṣaḥ
translated: then what is the difference between a knower and an unknowing person?

original: ity āśaṅkya tayor viśeṣaṃ darśayati prakṛter iti dvābhyām /
analyzed: iti āśaṅkya tayoḥ viśeṣam darśayati prakṛteḥ iti dvābhyām
translated: With this doubt in mind, he shows their difference in two verses beginning with prakrteh.

original: prakṛter guṇaiḥ kāryair indriyaiḥ sarvaśaḥ sarvaprakāreṇa kriyamāṇāni yāni karmāṇi tāny aham eva kartā karomīty avidvān manyate ////
analyzed: prakṛteḥ guṇaiḥ kāryaiḥ indriyaiḥ sarvaśas sarva prakāreṇa kriyamāṇāni yāni karmāṇi tāni aham eva kartā karomi iti avidvān manyate
translated: The unknowing person thinks that he is the doer of all actions performed by the qualities of prakriti, the senses, and in every way, and that he is doing them.

original: baladevaḥ / karmitvasāmye 'pi vijñājñayor viśeṣam āha prakṛter iti dvābhyām /
analyzed: baladevaḥ karmi tva sāmye vijña ajñayoḥ viśeṣam āha prakṛteḥ iti dvābhyām
translated: Balarama. He says in two verses that there is a difference between the wise and the ignorant, even though they are equal in being agents.

original: ahaṃkāravimūḍhātmā jano 'haṃ karmāṇi karteti manyate /
analyzed: ahaṃkāra vimūḍha ātmā janaḥ ham karmāṇi kartā iti manyate
translated: The person whose mind is deluded by egoism thinks I am the agent and I am doing the actions.

original: na lokāvyayaniṣṭhā iti sūtrāt ṣaṣṭhīniṣedhaḥ /
analyzed: na loka avyaya niṣṭhāḥ iti sūtrāt ṣaṣṭhī niṣedhaḥ
translated: The prohibition of the genitive case is from the sutra Not in the locative case of the indeclinable loka.

original: karmāṇi laukikāni vaidikāni ca /
analyzed: karmāṇi laukikāni vaidikāni ca
translated: The actions are worldly and Vedic.

original: tāni kīdṛśānīty āha prakṛter īśamāyāyā guṇais tatkāryair śarīrendriyaprāṇair īśvarapravartitaiḥ kriyamāṇānīti /
analyzed: tāni kīdṛśāni iti āha prakṛteḥ īśa māyāyāḥ guṇaiḥ tad kāryaiḥ śarīra indriya prāṇaiḥ īśvara pravartitaiḥ kriyamāṇāni iti
translated: What are they like? It is said: They are performed by the qualities of prakriti, the Lord's maya, by its effects, by the body, senses and life-force impelled by the Lord.

original: idam eva veditavyam upakramavinirṇayāt saṃvidvapurjīvātmāsmadarthaḥ kartā cānādikālaviṣayabhogavāsanākrāntas
analyzed: idam eva veditavyam upakrama vinirṇayāt saṃvid vapuḥ jīva ātmā asmad arthaḥ kartā ca anādi kāla viṣaya bhoga vāsanā ākrāntaḥ
translated: This alone should be known, from the determination of the beginning, the body of consciousness, the individual self, the object of I, the agent, overwhelmed by the latent impressions of experiences related to beginningless time,

original: tadbhogārthikāṃ svasannihitāṃ prakṛtim āśliṣṭas tatkāryeṇāhaṅkāreṇa vimūḍhātmā
analyzed: tad bhoga arthikām sva sannihitām prakṛtim āśliṣṭaḥ tad kāryeṇa ahaṅkāreṇa vimūḍha ātmā
translated: embracing the inherent prakriti for the sake of experiencing that, the self deluded by the ego, which is its effect,

original: tādṛśasvavijñānaśūnyaḥ śarīrādyahaṃbhāvavān prākṛtaiḥ śarīrādibhir īśena ca
analyzed: tādṛśa sva vijñāna śūnyaḥ śarīra ādi ahaṃbhāvavān prākṛtaiḥ śarīra ādibhiḥ īśena ca
translated: devoid of such self-knowledge, having the sense of I in the body etc., with the natural bodies etc., and with the Lord,

original: siddhāni karmāṇi mayaivaikena kṛtānīti manyate /🔽kartur ātmano yat kartṛtvaṃ tat kila dehādibhis
analyzed: siddhāni karmāṇi mayā eva ekena kṛtāni iti manyate  kartuḥ ātmanaḥ yat kartṛ tvam tat kila deha ādibhiḥ
translated: thinks that the accomplished actions are performed by him alone.🔽The agency of the agent, the self, is indeed accomplished by the three, the body etc.,

original: tribhiḥ paramātmanā ca sarvapravartakena ca siddhyati /
analyzed: tribhiḥ paramātmanā ca sarva pravartakena ca siddhi ati
translated: and by the supreme self, the instigator of all.

original: na tv ekena jīvenaiva /
analyzed: na tu ekena jīvena eva
translated: But not by the individual self alone.

original: tac ca mayaiva siddhyatīti jīvo yan manyate tad ahaṅkāravimauḍhyād eva adhiṣṭhānaṃ tathā karthā Gītā / ity ādikāc caramādhyāyavākyatrayāt
analyzed: tat ca mayā eva siddhi ati iti jīvaḥ yat manyate tat ahaṅkāra vimauḍhyāt eva adhiṣṭhānam tathā karthāḥ gītāḥ iti ādikāt carama adhyāya vākya trayāt
translated: And that is accomplished by me alone. This is what the individual soul thinks only out of the delusion of egoism. The substratum is so, as per the three statements from the last chapter beginning with The Lord is the enjoyer of the shares of sacrifices.

original: kāryakāraṇakartṛtve hetuḥ prakṛtir ucyate Gītā / ity atra śarīrendriyādikartṛtvaṃ prakṛter iti yad varṇayiṣyate /
analyzed: kārya kāraṇa kartṛ tve hetuḥ prakṛtiḥ ucyate gītā iti atra śarīra indriya ādi kartṛ tvam prakṛteḥ iti yat varṇayiṣyate
translated: In the verse The cause of the doership of the effect and the cause is said to be Prakriti, it will be described that the doership of the body, senses, etc. belongs to Prakriti.

original: tatrāpi kevalāyās tasyās tan na śakyaṃ mantum /
analyzed: tatra api kevalāyāḥ tasyāḥ tat na śakyam mantum
translated: Even there, that cannot be thought of as belonging to her alone.

original: puruṣasaṃsargeṇaiva tatpravṛtter aṅgīkārāt /
analyzed: puruṣa saṃsargeṇa eva tad pravṛtteḥ aṅgīkārāt
translated: Because it is accepted that her activity is only through contact with the Purusha.

original: tataś ca puruṣasya kartṛtvam avarjanīyam iti vyākhyāsyate ////
analyzed: tatas ca puruṣasya kartṛ tvam avarjanīyam iti vyākhyāsyate
translated: And therefore, it will be explained that the doership of the Purusha is unavoidable.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: (Bhagavad Gita 13.29)

original: tattvavit tu mahābāho guṇakarmavibhāgayoḥ /
analyzed: tattva vid tu mahā bāho guṇa karma vibhāgayoḥ
translated: But, O mighty-armed one, the knower of reality,

original: guṇā guṇeṣu vartanta iti matvā na sajjate ////
analyzed: guṇāḥ guṇeṣu vartante iti matvā na sajjate
translated: knowing that the qualities abide in the qualities, is not attached to them.

original: śrīdharaḥ / vidvāṃs tu na tathā manyate ity āha tattvavid iti /
analyzed: tu na   manyate iti āha   iti
translated: The blessed one says that the knower does not think like that.

original: nāhaṃ guṇātmaka iti guṇebhya ātmano vibhāgaḥ /
analyzed: na aham guṇa ātmakaḥ iti guṇebhyaḥ ātmanaḥ vibhāgaḥ
translated: I am not of the nature of the qualities - this is the distinction of the self from the qualities.

original: na me karmāṇīti karmabhyo 'py ātmano vibhāgaḥ /
analyzed: na me karmāṇi iti karmabhyaḥ pi ātmanaḥ vibhāgaḥ
translated: Actions do not belong to me - this is the distinction of the self from actions.

original: tayor guṇakarmavibhāgayor yas tattvaṃ vetti sa tu na kartṛtvābhiniveśaṃ na karoti /
analyzed: tayoḥ guṇa karma vibhāgayoḥ yaḥ tattvam vetti sa tu na kartṛ tva abhiniveśam na karoti
translated: He who knows the truth of these two, the division of the qualities and actions, he does not engage in the notion of being an agent.

original: tatra hetuḥ guṇā iti /
analyzed: tatra hetuḥ guṇāḥ iti
translated: The reason for that is stated: the qualities.

original: guṇā indriyāṇi guṇeṣu viṣayeṣu vartante nāham iti matvā ////
analyzed: guṇāḥ indriyāṇi guṇeṣu viṣayeṣu vartante na aham iti matvā
translated: The qualities are the senses. They function in the objects, the qualities. Thinking not I, he does not engage in the notion of being an agent.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: vidvāṃs tu tathā na manyata ity āha tattvavid iti /
analyzed: vidvān tu tathā na manyate iti āha tattva vid iti
translated: But the knower does not think so. Thus it is said: the knower of truth.

original: tattvaṃ yāthātmyaṃ vettīti tattvavit /
analyzed: tattvam yāthātmyam vetti iti tattva vid
translated: He who knows the truth, the nature of things, is the knower of truth.

original: tuśabdena tasyājñād vaiśiṣṭyam āha /
analyzed: tuśabdena tasya ājñāt vaiśiṣṭyam āha
translated: The word but states his superiority over the ignorant.

original: kasya tattvam ity ata āha guṇakarmavibhāgayoḥ /
analyzed: kasya tattvam iti atas āha guṇa karma vibhāgayoḥ
translated: Whose truth? To that it is said: of the division of the qualities and actions.

original: guṇā dehendriyāntaḥkaraṇāny ahaṅkārāspadāni karmāṇi ca teṣāṃ vyāpārabhūtāni mamakārāspadānīti guṇakarmeti dvandvaikavad bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: guṇāḥ deha indriya antaḥkaraṇāni ahaṅkāra āspadāni karmāṇi ca teṣām vyāpāra bhūtāni mamakāra āspadāni iti guṇa karma iti dvandva eka vat bhāvaḥ
translated: The qualities are the body, senses, and internal organs, which are the basis of egoism. The actions are their functions, which are the basis of possessiveness. Thus qualities and actions is a dvandva compound with singular ending.

original: vibhajyate sarveṣāṃ jaḍānāṃ vikāriṇāṃ bhāsakatvena pṛthag bhavatīti vibhāgaḥ svaprakāśajñānarūpo 'saṅga ātmā /
analyzed: vibhajyate sarveṣām jaḍānām vikāriṇām bhāsaka tvena pṛthak bhavati iti vibhāgaḥ sva prakāśa jñāna rūpaḥ saṅgaḥ ātmā
translated: The division is the self, which is the light of knowledge, unattached, and separate from all the inert and changing things as the illuminator.

original: guṇakarma ca vibhāgaś ceti dvandvaḥ /
analyzed: guṇa karma ca vibhāgaḥ ca iti dvandvaḥ
translated: Qualities and actions is a dvandva compound.

original: tayor guṇakarmavibhāgayor bhāsyabhāsakayor jaḍacaitanyayor vikārinirvikārayos
analyzed: tayoḥ guṇa karma vibhāgayoḥ bhāsya bhāsakayoḥ jaḍa caitanyayoḥ vikāri nirvikārayoḥ
translated: He who knows the truth, the nature, of those two, the division of qualities and actions, the illuminated and the illuminator, the inert and the conscious, the modified and the unmodified,

original: tattvaṃ yāthātmyaṃ yo vetti sa guṇāḥ karaṇātmakā guṇeṣu viṣayeṣu pravartante vikāritvān
analyzed: tattvam yāthātmyam yaḥ vetti sa guṇāḥ karaṇa ātmakāḥ guṇeṣu viṣayeṣu pravartante
translated: The qualities, which are of the nature of the organs, operate on the objects, the qualities, because of their being modified.

original: na tu nirvikāra ātmeti matvā na sajjate saktiṃ kartṛtvābhiniveśam atattvavid iva na karoti /
analyzed: na tu nirvikāraḥ ātmā iti matvā na sajjate saktim kartṛ tva abhiniveśam a tattva vid iva na karoti
translated: But the Self, which is unmodified, does not become attached, does not perform actions out of the false identification with the doer, like one who does not know the truth.

original: he mahābāho
analyzed: he mahābāho
translated: O mighty-armed one,

original: iti sambodhayan sāmudrikoktasatpuruṣalakṣaṇayogitvān na pṛthagjanasādhāraṇyena tvam avivekī bhavitum arhasīti sūcayati /
analyzed: iti sambodhayan sāmudrika ukta sat puruṣa lakṣaṇa yogitvāt na pṛthagjana sādhāraṇyena tvam avivekī bhavitum arhasi iti sūcayati
translated: By addressing him thus, he indicates that he should not be unreflective like an ordinary person, because he possesses the characteristics of a good man as described in the science of physiognomy.

original: guṇavibhāgasya karmavibhāgasya ca tattvavid iti vā /
analyzed: guṇa vibhāgasya karma vibhāgasya ca tattva vid iti vā
translated: Or, he who knows the truth of the division of qualities and the division of actions.

original: asmin pakṣe guṇakarmaṇor ity etāvataiva nirvāhe vibhāgapadasya prayojanaṃ cintyam ////
analyzed: asmin pakṣe guṇa karmaṇoḥ iti etāvatā eva nirvāhe vibhāga padasya prayojanam cintyam
translated: In this case, the purpose of the word division should be considered, since it is sufficient to say of qualities and actions alone for the completion of the meaning.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: guṇakarmaṇor yau vibhāgau tayos tattvaṃ vettīti saḥ /
analyzed: guṇa karmaṇoḥ yau vibhāgau tayoḥ tattvam vetti iti saḥ
translated: He who knows the truth of the two divisions of qualities and actions.

original: tatra guṇavibhāgaḥ sattvarajastamāṃsi /
analyzed: tatra guṇa vibhāgaḥ sattva rajaḥ tamāṃsi
translated: There, the division of qualities is sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: karmavibhāgaḥ sattvādikāryabhedā devatendriyaviṣayāḥ /
analyzed: karma vibhāgaḥ sattva ādi kārya bhedāḥ devatā indriya viṣayāḥ
translated: The division of actions is the different effects of sattva etc., which are the deities, sense organs, and objects.

original: tayos tattvaṃ svarūpaṃ /
analyzed: tayoḥ tattvam svarūpam
translated: Their truth is their nature.

original: tajjñas tu tattvavit /
analyzed: tad jñaḥ tu tattva vid
translated: But one who knows that is a knower of the truth.

original: guṇā devatāḥ prayojyānīndriyāṇi cakṣurādīni guṇeṣu rūpādiṣu viṣayeṣu vartante /
analyzed: guṇāḥ devatāḥ prayojyāni indriyāṇi cakṣuḥ ādīni guṇeṣu rūpa ādiṣu viṣayeṣu vartante
translated: The senses such as the eyes are to be employed as the deities in the qualities such as form, etc.

original: ahaṃ tu na guṇaḥ /
analyzed: aham tu na guṇaḥ
translated: But I am not a quality.

original: nāpi guṇakāryaḥ ko 'pi /
analyzed: na api guṇa kāryaḥ
translated: Nor am I anything produced by a quality.

original: nāpi guṇeṣu guṇakāryeṣu teṣu me ko 'pi sambandha iti matvā vidvāṃs tu na sajjate ////
analyzed: nā api guṇeṣu guṇa kāryeṣu teṣu me kaḥ sambandhaḥ iti matvā vidvān tu na sajjate
translated: Nor do I have any connection with those qualities or their effects. Thinking thus, the wise one is not attached.

original: baladevaḥ / vijñas tu na tathety āha tattvavit tv iti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ vijñaḥ tu na tathā iti āha tattva vid tu iti
translated: Balarama. But the knower is not like that, says the knower of the truth.

original: guṇavibhāgasya karmavibhāgasya ca tattvavit /🔽guṇebhya indriyebhyaḥ karmabhyaś ca tatkṛtebhyo yaḥ svayasa vibhāgo bhedas tasya tattvaṃ svarūpaṃ tattadvaidharmyaparyālocanayā yo nāhaṃ
analyzed: guṇa vibhāgasya karma vibhāgasya ca tattva vid  guṇebhyaḥ indriyebhyaḥ karmabhyaḥ ca tad kṛtebhyaḥ yaḥ svayasa vibhāgaḥ bhedaḥ tasya tattvam svarūpam tad tad vaidharmya paryālocanayā yaḥ na aham
translated: He is the knower of the truth of the division of qualities and the division of actions.

original: guṇakarmavapuḥ iti vettīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: guṇa karma vapuḥ iti vetti iti arthaḥ
translated: The truth of that division, which is the difference from the qualities and actions produced by them, is its nature, which is known by examining its contrary properties as I am not the body of qualities and actions. This is the meaning.

original: sa hi guṇā indriyāṇi guṇeṣu śabdādiṣu viṣayeṣu tattaddevatāpreritāni pravartante tān prakāśayanti /
analyzed: sa hi guṇāḥ indriyāṇi guṇeṣu śabda ādiṣu viṣayeṣu tad tad devatā preritāni pravartante tān prakāśayanti
translated: For those qualities are the senses, which are engaged in the objects such as sound etc. by being impelled by their respective deities, and they manifest them.

original: ahaṃ tv asaṅgavijñānānandatvāt tadbhinno /
analyzed: aham tu asaṅga vijñāna ānanda tvāt tad bhinnaḥ
translated: But I am different from them, because I am the bliss of detached consciousness.

original: na teṣu tādrūpyeṇa varte /
analyzed: na teṣu tādrūpyeṇa varte
translated: I do not exist in them in that form.

original: na tān prakāśayāmīti matvā teṣu na sajjante /
analyzed: na tān prakāśayāmi iti matvā teṣu na sajjante
translated: Thinking, 'I do not reveal them,' they do not become attached to them.

original: kintv ātmany eva sajjate /
analyzed: kintu ātmani eva sajjate
translated: But they become attached to the Self alone.

original: atrāpi matvety anena kartṛtvaṃ jīvasyoktaṃ bodhyam ////
analyzed: atra api matvā iti anena kartṛ tvam jīvasya uktam bodhyam
translated: Here also, by the word 'matvā' (thinking), the agency of the individual soul should be understood.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: prakṛter guṇasaṃmūḍhāḥ sajjante guṇakarmasu /
analyzed: prakṛteḥ guṇa saṃmūḍhāḥ sajjante guṇa karmasu
translated: Confused by the qualities of Nature, they become attached to the activities of the qualities.

original: tān akṛtsnavido mandān kṛtsnavin na vicālayet ////
analyzed: tān akṛtsna vidaḥ mandān kṛtsna vid na vicālayet
translated: The knower of the whole should not disturb those slow-witted ones who know only a part.

original: śrīdharaḥ / na buddhibhedam ity upasaṃharati prakṛter iti /
translated: Śrīdhara: He concludes with prakrteh (of Nature).

original: ye prakṛter guṇaiḥ sattvādibhiḥ saṃmūḍhāḥ santaḥ guṇeṣv indriyeṣu tatkarmasu ca sajjante /
analyzed: ye prakṛteḥ guṇaiḥ sattva ādibhiḥ saṃmūḍhāḥ santaḥ guṇeṣu indriyeṣu tad karmasu ca sajjante
translated: Those who are confused by the qualities of Nature, such as sattva, become attached to the qualities, the senses, and their activities.

original: tān akṛtsnavido mandān mandamatīn kṛtsnavit sarvajño na vicālayet ////
analyzed: tān akṛtsna vidaḥ mandān manda matīn kṛtsna vid sarvajñaḥ na vicālayet
translated: The knower of the whole, the omniscient one, should not disturb those slow-witted ones who know only a part.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana:

original: tad evaṃ vidvadaviduṣoḥ karmānuṣṭhānasāmyena vidvān aviduṣo buddhibhedaṃ na kuryād ity uktam upasaṃharati /
analyzed: tat evam vidvat aviduṣoḥ karma anuṣṭhāna sāmyena vidvān aviduṣaḥ buddhi bhedam na kuryāt iti uktam upasaṃharati
translated: Thus, it has been said that the knower should not create a difference in the understanding of the ignorant by similarity in the performance of actions of the knower and the ignorant. He concludes with prakrteh (of Nature).

original: prakṛteḥ pūrvoktāyā māyāyā guṇaiḥ kāryatayā dharmair dehādibhir vikāraiḥ samyaṅ mūḍhāḥ
analyzed: prakṛteḥ pūrva uktāyāḥ māyāyāḥ guṇaiḥ kāryatayā dharmaiḥ deha ādibhiḥ vikāraiḥ samyak mūḍhāḥ
translated: Those who are completely deluded by the qualities of Nature mentioned earlier, by its effects such as the gunas (sattva etc.), and by its modifications such as the body etc.,

original: svarūpāsphuraṇena tān evātmatvena manyamānās teṣām eva guṇānāṃ dehendriyāntaḥkaraṇānāṃ
analyzed: sva rūpa āsphuraṇena tān eva ātma tvena manyamānāḥ teṣām eva guṇānām deha indriya antaḥkaraṇānām
translated: Considering those very qualities of the body, senses, and internal organs as the self due to the non-manifestation of their own nature,

original: karmasu vyāpāreṣu sajjante saktiṃ vayaṃ kurmas tatphalāyeti dṛḍhatarām ātmīyabuddhiṃ
analyzed: karmasu vyāpāreṣu sajjante saktim vayam kurmaḥ tad phalāya iti dṛḍhatarām ātmīya buddhim
translated: they become strongly attached to the activities of those very qualities, thinking We shall perform actions for that result,

original: kurvanti ye tān karmasaṅgino 'kṛtsnavido 'nātmābhimānino madnān aśuddhacittatvena
analyzed: kurvanti ye tān karma saṅginaḥ kṛtsna vidaḥ na ātma abhimāninaḥ madnān a śuddha citta tvena
translated: and form a firm notion of ownership. Those who do so are called attached to action, not knowing the whole, conceited with the notion of the non-self, and with impure minds

original: jñānādhikāram aprāptān kṛtsnavit paripūrṇātmavit svayaṃ na vicālayet karmaśraddhāto
analyzed: jñāna adhikāram a prāptān kṛtsna vid paripūrṇa ātma vid svayam na vicālayet karma śraddhātaḥ
translated: due to their attachment to action. The knower of the whole, the knower of the complete self, should not himself unsettle those who have not attained the right to knowledge.

original: na pracyāvayed ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: na pracyāvayet iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that he should not cause them to fall away from their faith in action.

original: ye tv amandāḥ śuddhāntaḥkaraṇās te svayam eva vivekodayena vicalanti jñānādhikāraṃ prāptā ity abhiprāyaḥ /
analyzed: ye tu amandāḥ śuddha antaḥkaraṇāḥ te svayam eva viveka udayena vicalanti jñāna adhikāram prāptāḥ iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: But those who are not dull, whose internal organs are pure, they themselves become unsettled through the dawning of discrimination and attain the right to knowledge - this is the idea.

original: kṛtsnākṛtsnaśabdāv ātmānātmaparatayā śrutyarthānusāreṇa vārtikakṛdbhir vyākhyātau
analyzed: kṛtsna akṛtsna śabdau ātma anātma para tayā śruti artha anusāreṇa vārtika kṛdbhiḥ vyākhyātau
translated: The words whole and not whole have been explained by the commentators in accordance with the meaning of the scriptures as referring to the self and the not-self respectively.

original: sad evety ādivākyebhyaḥ kṛtsnaṃ vastu yato 'dvayam /
analyzed: sat eva iti ādi vākyebhyaḥ kṛtsnam vastu yatas dvayam
translated: From the statements beginning with 'existence alone,' the entire reality is non-dual.

original: sambhavas tadviruddhasya kuto 'kṛtsnasya vastunaḥ //
analyzed: sambhavaḥ tad viruddhasya kutas kṛtsnasya vastunaḥ
translated: How can there be a possibility of a reality that is contrary to that, which is not whole?

original: yasmin dṛṣṭe 'py adṛṣṭo 'rthaḥ sa tad anyaś ca śiṣyate /
analyzed: yasmin dṛṣṭe pi adṛṣṭaḥ rthaḥ sa tat anyaḥ ca śiṣyate
translated: In which, even when seen, the object not seen remains as different from it.

original: tathādṛṣṭe 'pi dṛṣṭaḥ syād akṛtsnas tādṛg ucyate // iti /
analyzed: tathā adṛṣṭe pi dṛṣṭaḥ syāt akṛtsnaḥ tādṛś ucyate iti
translated: Even when not seen in that way, it would be seen, and is said to be incomplete.

original: anātmanaḥ sāvayavatvād anekadharmavattāc ca kenacid dharmeṇa kenacid avayavena vā
analyzed: anātmanaḥ sāvayava tvāt aneka dharmavattāt ca kenacid dharmeṇa kenacid avayavena vā
translated: Because the non-self is composed of parts and has many properties, by some property or by some part,

original: viśiṣṭe tasminn ekasmin ghaṭādau jñāte 'pi dharmāntareṇa avayavāntareṇa vā viśiṣṭaḥ
analyzed: viśiṣṭe tasmin ekasmin ghaṭa ādau jñāte dharma antareṇa avayava antareṇa vā viśiṣṭaḥ
translated: when that one pot, etc. is known as distinguished, still that very one distinguished by another property or another part

original: sa evājñāto 'vaśiṣyate /
analyzed: saḥ eva ajñātaḥ vaśiṣyate
translated: remains unknown.

original: tad anyaś ca paṭādir ajñāto ' vaśiṣyata eva /
analyzed: tat anyaḥ ca paṭa ādiḥ ajñātaḥ
translated: And something else, like a cloth, remains unknown.

original: tathā tasmin ghaṭādāv ajñāte 'pi paṭādir jñātaḥ syād iti tajjñāne 'pi tasyānyasya cājñānāt tadajñāne py anyajñānāc ca so 'kṛtsna ucyate
analyzed: tathā tasmin ghaṭa ādau ajñāte pi paṭa ādiḥ jñātaḥ syāt iti tad jñāne pi tasya anyasya ca ajñānāt tad ajñāne pi anya jñānāt ca saḥ kṛtsnaḥ ucyate
translated: Similarly, even when that pot, etc. is unknown, a cloth, etc. would be known. Thus, even in the knowledge of that, the other remains unknown. And because the other is known even when that is unknown, it is said to be incomplete.

original: kṛtsnas tv advaya ātmaiva tajjñāne kasyacid avaśeṣasyābhāvād iti ślokadvayārthaḥ ////
analyzed: kṛtsnaḥ tu advayaḥ ātmā eva tad jñāne kasyacid avaśeṣasya abhāvāt iti śloka dvaya arthaḥ
translated: But the complete, non-dual self is said to be so because of the absence of the remainder of anything in the knowledge of that. This is the meaning of the two verses.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: nanu yadi jīvā guṇebhyo guṇakāryebhyaś ca pṛthagbhūtās tadasambandhās tarhi kathaṃ te viṣayeṣu sajjanto dṛśyante /
analyzed: nanu yadi jīvāḥ guṇebhyaḥ guṇa kāryebhyaḥ ca pṛthak bhūtāḥ tad asambandhāḥ tarhi katham te viṣayeṣu sajjantaḥ dṛśyante
translated: Now, if the individual souls are separate from the qualities and the effects of the qualities, then how is it that they are seen to be attached to objects?

original: tatrāha prakṛter guṇasaṃmūḍhās tadāveśāt prāptasaṃmohā yathā bhūtāviṣṭo manuṣya ātmānaṃ bhūtam eva manyate /🔽tathaiva prakṛtiguṇāviṣṭā jīvāḥ svān guṇān eva manyante /
analyzed: tatra āha prakṛteḥ guṇa saṃmūḍhāḥ tad āveśāt prāpta saṃmohāḥ yathā bhūta āviṣṭaḥ manuṣyaḥ ātmānam bhūtam eva manyate  tathā eva prakṛti guṇa āviṣṭāḥ jīvāḥ svān guṇān eva manyante
translated: To this he says: Being deluded by the qualities of Nature, they, being possessed by them, attain delusion, just as a man possessed by a ghost considers himself to be the ghost.🔽In the same way, the individual souls, possessed by the qualities of Nature, consider their own qualities [to be themselves].

original: tato guṇakarmasu guṇakāryeṣu viṣayeṣu sajjante /
analyzed: tatas guṇa karmasu guṇa kāryeṣu viṣayeṣu sajjante
translated: Therefore, they become attached to the qualities and the objects which are the effects of the qualities.

original: tān akṛtsnavido mandamatīn kṛtsnavit sarvajño na vicālayet /
analyzed: tān akṛtsna vidaḥ manda matīn kṛtsna vid sarvajñaḥ na vicālayet
translated: The Omniscient One, who knows everything, would not disturb those who know only a part [of the truth] and whose intellect is dull.

original: tvaṃ guṇebhyaḥ pṛthagbhūto jīvo na tu guṇaḥ iti vicāraṃ prāpayituṃ na yatate /
analyzed: tvam guṇebhyaḥ pṛthak bhūtaḥ jīvaḥ na tu guṇaḥ iti vicāram prāpayitum na yatate
translated: He does not strive to bring about the consideration that you, the individual soul, are separate from the qualities, and are not a quality.

original: kintu guṇāveśanivartakaṃ niṣkāmakarmaiva kārayet /
analyzed: kintu guṇa āveśa nivartakam niṣkāma karma eva kārayet
translated: But he would make [them perform] only action without desire, which removes the possession by the qualities.

original: na hi bhūtāviṣṭo manuṣyaḥ na tvaṃ bhūtaḥ kintu manuṣya eva iti śatakṛtve 'py upadeśena na svāsthyam āpadyate /
analyzed: na hi bhūta āviṣṭaḥ manuṣyaḥ na tvam bhūtaḥ kintu manuṣyaḥ eva iti śata kṛtve pi upadeśena na svāsthyam āpadyate
translated: For a man possessed by a ghost does not attain normalcy even by being taught a hundred times that he is not a ghost but a man.

original: kintu tannivartakauṣudhamaṇimantrādiprayogenaiveti bhāvaḥ ////
analyzed: kintu tad nivartaka auṣudha maṇi mantra ādi prayogena eva iti bhāvaḥ
translated: But [he attains normalcy] only by the application of herbs, gems, mantras, etc. which remove that [possession]. This is the idea.

original: baladevaḥ / na buddhibhedaṃ janayed ity etad upasaṃharati prakṛter iti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ na buddhi bhedam janayet iti etat upasaṃharati prakṛteḥ iti
translated: Balarama. He concludes this [verse] beginning with na buddhi-bhedam janayet (one should not create a difference in the intellect).

original: prakṛter guṇena tatkāryeṇāhaṅkāreṇa mūḍhā bhūtāveśanyāyena dehādikam evātmānaṃ manyamānā janā guṇānāṃ dehendriyāṇāṃ karmasu vyāpāreṣu sajjante
analyzed: prakṛteḥ guṇena tad kāryeṇa ahaṅkāreṇa mūḍhāḥ bhūta āveśa nyāyena deha ādikam eva ātmānam manyamānāḥ janāḥ guṇānām deha indriyāṇām karmasu vyāpāreṣu sajjante
translated: People, deluded by the ego, which is the effect of the quality of Nature, consider the body etc. as the Self, in the manner of the entry of the elements. They are attached to the activities of the qualities, i.e. the body and senses, in their operations.

original: tān akṛtsnavido 'lpajñān mandān ātmatattvagrahaṇālasān kṛtsnavit pūrṇātmajñāno na vicālayet guṇakarmānyo viśuddhacaitanyānandas tvam
analyzed: tān akṛtsna vidaḥ lpa jñān mandān ātma tattva grahaṇa alasān kṛtsna vid pūrṇa ātma jñānaḥ na vicālayet guṇa karma anyaḥ viśuddha caitanya ānandaḥ tvam
translated: The knower of the whole, i.e. one who has full knowledge of the Self, should not disturb those who know only a part, i.e. who have little knowledge, who are slow, who are reluctant to grasp the truth about the Self. You are distinct from the qualities and actions, and have pure consciousness and bliss as your nature.

original: iti tattvaṃ grāhayituṃ necchet /
analyzed: iti tattvam grāhayitum na icchet
translated: He should not wish to make them accept that truth.

original: kintu tadrucim anusṛtya vaidikakarmāṇi śreṇyākramād ātmatattvapravaṇaṃ cikīrsed iti bhāvaḥ ////
analyzed: kintu tad rucim anusṛtya vaidika karmāṇi śreṇyā kramāt ātma tattva pravaṇam cikīrset iti bhāvaḥ
translated: But following their inclination, he should desire to make them inclined towards the truth about the Self through the Vedic actions in due order. This is the idea.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: mayi sarvāṇi karmāṇi saṃnyasyādhyātmacetasā /
analyzed: mayi sarvāṇi karmāṇi saṃnyasya adhyātma cetasā
translated: Renouncing all actions in Me, with a mind devoted to the Supreme Self,

original: nirāśīr nirmamo bhūtvā yudhyasva vigatajvaraḥ ////
analyzed: nirāśīḥ nirmamaḥ bhūtvā yudhyasva vigata jvaraḥ
translated: Be free from desire and egoism, and fight, free from worry.

original: śrīdharaḥ / tad evaṃ tattvavido 'pi karma kartavyam /
translated: Shridhar: Thus, even a knower of the truth should perform actions.

original: tvaṃ tu nādyāpi tattvavit /🔽ataḥ karmaiva kurv ity āha mayīti /
analyzed: tvam tu na adya api tattva vid  atas karma eva kuru iti āha mayi iti
translated: But you are not yet a knower of the truth.🔽Therefore, perform only actions, says the Lord in Mayi etc.

original: sarvāṇi karmāṇi mayi saṃnyasya samarpya /
analyzed: sarvāṇi karmāṇi mayi saṃnyasya samarpya
translated: Renounce, i.e. dedicate, all actions in Me.

original: adhyātmacetasā antaryāmyadhīno 'haṃ karma karomīti dṛṣṭyā /
analyzed: adhyātma cetasā antaryāmi adhīnaḥ ham karma karomi iti dṛṣṭyā
translated: With the thought, 'I am working under the control of the inner controller, the Supreme Self,' with the mind turned inward.

original: nirāśī niṣkāmaḥ /
analyzed: nirāśī niṣkāmaḥ
translated: Free from desire, free from longing.

original: ataeva matphalasādhanaṃ madartham idaṃ karmety evaṃ mamatāśūnyaś ca bhūtvā /
analyzed: ataeva mad phala sādhanam mad artham idam karma iti evam mamatā śūnyaḥ ca bhūtvā
translated: And for that very reason, being devoid of the notion, 'This work is for Me, the means to My result,'

original: vigatajvaras tyaktaśokaś ca bhūtvā ////
analyzed: vigata jvaraḥ tyakta śokaḥ ca bhūtvā
translated: and becoming free from fever, free from sorrow.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: evaṃ karmānuṣṭhānasāmye 'py ajñavijñeyoḥ kartṛtvābhiniveśatadabhāvābhyāṃ viśeṣa uktaḥ /
analyzed: evam karma anuṣṭhāna sāmye pi ajña vijñeyoḥ kartṛ tva abhiniveśa tad abhāvābhyām viśeṣaḥ uktaḥ
translated: Thus, even when there is equality in the performance of work, the difference between the ignorant and the wise is stated to be due to the absence of attachment to the idea of being the doer and the presence of that idea, respectively.

original: idānīm ajñasyāpi mumukṣor amumukṣvapekṣayā bhagavadarpaṇaṃ phalābhisandhyabhāvaṃ ca viśeṣaṃ vadann ajñatayārjunasya karmādhikāraṃ draḍhayati
analyzed: idānīm ajñasya api mumukṣoḥ amumukṣu apekṣayā bhagavat arpaṇam phala abhisandhi abhāvam ca viśeṣam vadan ajña tayā arjunasya karma adhikāram draḍhayati  /
translated: Now, even for the ignorant seeker of liberation, the difference in relation to the non-seeker of liberation is stated to be the reflection on the Lord and the absence of longing for results, and thus the eligibility of Arjuna, who is ignorant, for work is confirmed.

original: mayīti /
analyzed: mayi iti
translated: By the word 'mayi' (in Me).

original: mayi bhagavati vāsudeve parameśvare sarvajñe sarvaniyantari sarvātmani sarvāṇi karmāṇi🔽laukikāni vaidikāni ca sarvaprakārāṇi adhyātmacetasāhaṃ kartāntaryāmyadhīnas tasmā
analyzed: mayi bhagavati vāsudeve parameśvare sarvajñe sarva niyantari sarva ātmani sarvāṇi karmāṇi  laukikāni vaidikāni ca sarva prakārāṇi adhyātma cetasā aham kartā antaryāmi adhīnaḥ tasmai
translated: All actions, worldly and Vedic, of every kind, are in Me, in the Lord Vasudeva, the Supreme God, the Omniscient, the Controller of all, the Self of all.🔽With the mind turned inward, I am the doer, under the control of the inner controller, the Supreme Self.

original: eveśvarāya rājña iva bhṛtyaḥ karmāṇi karomīty anayā buddhyā saṃnyasya samarpya nirāśīr
analyzed: eva īśvarāya rājñe iva bhṛtyaḥ karmāṇi karomi iti anayā buddhyā saṃnyasya samarpya nirāśīḥ
translated: Therefore, with the idea, 'Like a servant to a king, I am doing these actions for the Lord alone,' having renounced, having offered, free from desire,

original: niṣkāmo nirmamo dehaputrabhrātrādiṣu svīyeṣu mamatāśūnyo vigatajvaraḥ /
analyzed: niṣkāmaḥ nirmamaḥ deha putra bhrātṛ ādiṣu svīyeṣu mamatā śūnyaḥ vigata jvaraḥ
